text: When you sit to eat with a ruler,
you shall surely observe what \add is\add* before you,
and you shall put a knife to your throat
if you have a ⸤big appetite⸥.\f + \fr 23:2 \ft Literally “lord/master of life” \f*
Do not desire his delicacies,
for\f + \fr 23:3 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* it is food of deception.
Do not tire \add in order\add* to become rich;
out of your understanding, \add may you\add* desist.
Your eyes will ⸤alight⸥\f + \fr 23:5 \ft Literally “cause to fly” \f* on it, but there is nothing \add to\add* it,
for suddenly it will make for itself wings
like an eagle and it will be exhausted \add in\add* the heavens.
Do not eat the bread of ⸤the stingy⸥,\f + \fr 23:6 \ft Literally “stingy of eye” \f*
and do not desire his delicacies.
For, like hair in his ⸤throat⸥,\f + \fr 23:7 \ft Literally “soul,” or “inner self” \f* so it is.\f + \fr 23:7 \ft Or “is he” \f*
“Eat and drink!” he will say to you,
but his heart will not be with you.
Your morsel you have eaten, you will vomit it up,
and you will waste your pleasant words.
In the ears of a fool do not speak,
for he will despise the wisdom of your words.
Do not remove an ancient boundary marker,
and on the fields of orphans do not encroach;
For their redeemer is strong,
he himself will plead their cause against you.
Apply your heart\f + \fr 23:12 \ft Or “mind” \f* to instruction,
and your ear to sayings of knowledge.
Do not withhold discipline from a child,
if you will beat him with the rod, he will not die.
As for you, with the rod you shall beat him,
and his life\f + \fr 23:14 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f* you will save from Sheol.\f + \fr 23:14 \ft A term for the place where the dead reside, i.e., the Underworld \f*
My child, if your heart\f + \fr 23:15 \ft Or “mind” \f* is wise,
my heart will be glad—even me!
And my ⸤insides⸥\f + \fr 23:16 \ft Literally “kidneys” \f* will rejoice
when your lips speak what is upright.
May your heart\f + \fr 23:17 \ft Or “mind” \f* not envy the sinners,
but \add live\add* in fear of Yahweh ⸤all day⸥.\f + \fr 23:17 \ft Literally “all the day” \f*
⸤Surely⸥\f + \fr 23:18 \ft Literally “For if” \f* there is a future,
and your hope will not be cut off.
You, my child, hear and be wise,
and direct your heart\f + \fr 23:19 \ft Or “mind” \f* on the road.
Do not be among drinkers of wine,
among gluttonous eaters of ⸤their meat⸥.\f + \fr 23:20 \ft Literally “meat for them” \f*
For the drunkard and gluttonous, they will become poor,
and \add with\add* rags, drowsiness will clothe them.
Listen to your father—he who ⸤gave you life⸥,\f + \fr 23:22 \ft Literally “caused you to be born” \f*
and do not despise your mother when\f + \fr 23:22 \ft Or “for, because” \f* she is old.
Buy truth and do not sell \add it\add*,
wisdom and instruction and understanding.
The father of the righteous will surely rejoice;
he who bears a wise person will be happy with him.
May your father and your mother be glad,
and may she who bore you rejoice.
My child, may you give your heart\f + \fr 23:26 \ft Or “mind” \f* to me,
and may your eyes delight in my ways.
For a deep pit is a prostitute,\f + \fr 23:27 \ft Or “whore” \f*
and a narrow well is ⸤an adulteress⸥.\f + \fr 23:27 \ft Literally “a foreign woman” \f*
She \add is\add* also like a robber lying in wait,
and the faithless among mankind she increases.
To whom \add is\add* woe? To whom \add is\add* sorrow? To whom \add are\add* quarrels? To whom \add is\add* complaint?
To whom \add are\add* wounds without cause? To whom \add is\add* redness of \add the\add* eyes?
To those who linger over wine,
to those who come to try mixed wine.
Do not look at wine when it is red,
when it ⸤sparkles⸥\f + \fr 23:31 \ft Literally “gives its eye” \f* on the cup,
going down smoothly.
⸤In the end⸥,\f + \fr 23:32 \ft Literally “end him” \f* it will bite like a serpent,
and it will sting like an adder.
Your eyes will see strange things,
and your heart\f + \fr 23:33 \ft Or “mind” \f* will speak perverse things.
And you will be like him who lies down in the heart of the sea,
and like him who lies down on top of a mast.
“They struck me; I was not hurt. They beat me; I did not know \add it\add*.
When I will awake, I will continue; I will seek it again.”
